title: Navigating Food Challenges with Daily Harvest's CEO
description:
You have an idea of how this parenting thing will go… and then life gets messy. Your toddler isn’t walking yet. Or your baby has food allergies. Maybe your first-grader needs extra support at school. What do we do in these moments when things don’t go as expected? This week’s guest, Rachel Drori—CEO of clean eating company Daily Harvest and mom of two —understands this struggle. When her oldest son was just nine months old, he had a severe anaphylactic reaction after eating cashews. She talks openly with Dr. Becky about the anxiety of raising a child with extreme food allergies and the impulse to blame herself. The two friends share coping strategies for deshaming our self-blame, finding control amidst chaos, and learning to trust your instincts as a parent. No matter what unexpected twists and turns you’ve faced with your kids, their conversation will remind you you’re not alone and equip you with the tools to handle whatever comes your way.<p/>
